alert.note: Alert for Modoc County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 13 at 5:43PM PST until February 14 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 7 PM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...West winds 25 to 40 mph with gusts up to 45 mph expected. * WHERE...The higher terrain of eastern Modoc County in California, including Highway 299 near Cedar Pass, an the higher terrain of Lake and Klamath Counties in Oregon, including portions of Highway 395, and Highway 31 between Paisley and Summer Lake. * WHEN...From 10 AM to 7 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
